attributes.action: I would like it to be made compulsory for a child to have a DNA test at birth.
attributes.background: I believe that it is the number 1 human right to know who you are. Technology makes this possible it needs to be compulsory so people don’t find out in adulthood that their biological father isn’t who they thought it was.
attributes.additional_details:
I would like the government to step in and make it compulsory for a child to have a DNA test at birth and give the child the knowledge of who their fathers are and vice versa
 
The DNA sample should be destroyed and other further information should be taken. The result should be entered on a child's birth certificate.
 
I am a mother and I believe children and men need to know who they are related too. It will takes away doubt and makes for a more confident, honest society, for children to grow up in.

attributes.action: New powers to take over failing schools
attributes.background: Government and local authorities need powers to take over failing schools. After the notification in March this year to close Plymouth Studio School, it was acknowledged that the secondary school system in Plymouth is failing our children. The Government must intervene.
attributes.additional_details: Six months on and into a new school year, the children from Studio School have been forgotten and the standards of our Plymouth Secondary Schools are well below the national average. Exam results are well below what they should be and although MPs have spoken out, I can see no action or improvements. The promises made to the Studio School children haven’t been upheld and they have been swept under the carpet. The current system is failing our children. The Government must accept responsibility.

attributes.action: Make emotional abuse and bullying a criminal offence
attributes.background: Unless there has been a threat of violence, nothing can be done to stop emotional abuse. This seriously affects mental health. This is a major problem for ex-partners and their children. Emotional abuse should be illegal.
attributes.additional_details: It is also not possible for someone to leave their job for bullying and to go onto job seeker's allowance despite this affecting their mental health due to this not currently being seen as an issue.

attributes.action: Re-instate legal aid in all childrens' cases
attributes.background: Currently the law with regards to legal aid and childrens cases only comes into effect if the case is in a public interest, private cases are not covered under legal aid and because of this those who can not afford a solicitor are being forced to prove they are exempt from paying court costs.
attributes.additional_details: This petition is to request that legal aid is made available on all cases regarding child law so that no person fighting for custody or access under private law is penalized or forced into debt by having to fund court cases over their child, every parent has a right and legal aid should be available for all not just the privileged few that are able to represent themselves. Without this those on benefits are unable to have assistance from solicitors to help with their case

attributes.action: All Ballot papers for all elections should have a box saying “none of the above”
attributes.background: Many people want to use their vote but don’t feel  that any of the options on the ballot paper don’t represent their views enough for people to vote for a particular party or person . A voter should have the option  to register that they have made a vote but don’t not for what is on offer
attributes.additional_details: This may be seen as a negative but it actually people being positive about wanting to vote and using their rights but also telling parties you’re not doing enough to listen to what I think I’m prepared to vote but only for what I want not what you’re telling me I should want .  Voted shouldn’t feel forced into either not voting or voting for a party they don’t agree with because they want to keep the right to vote . People can register this disapproval with what’s on offer and even the current system

attributes.action: Require public transport providers to offer free transport to those in education
attributes.background: Most people who are still in education don't have a well paying job, or don't even have one. This means that travelling around is hard and can be very costly.
attributes.additional_details: We are taking part in a citizenship project and this is our topic/ issue. Not only will this make transport easier for people who are still trying to learn, but also means that the roads are clearer of young drivers. This therefore results in pollution levels from transport decreasing

attributes.action: Introduce paid bereavement leave as an employment right
attributes.background: Losing a loved one is traumatic, stressful & demanding, but there is no legal requirement for employers to provide paid bereavement leave.
attributes.additional_details:
Introduce paid bereavement leave as an employment right
Losing a loved one is traumatic, stressful & demanding, but there is no legal requirement for employers to provide paid bereavement leave.

This means employers can force people to immediately return to work or go unpaid/use their holiday, which is unacceptable & counter-productive for well-being.

attributes.action: Do not legislate to renew community radio licences after 15 years - readvertise!
attributes.background: At 15 years we think the question must be asked "is this proposal still the best one out there? Could someone else do better?". Currently community radio licences stop at 15 years and have to be fully readvertised. Politicians are discussing allowing further blind renewals, which we think is wrong.
attributes.additional_details: Originally community radio licences were intended to be awarded for a 5-year term. Parliament then extended this to 10-years, then 15.   However these extensions do not ask the question "Is this the best use of the radio spectrum?". 15 years ago most towns/cities had local radio stations, now most are networked shows. Many community stations also have had changed and for some the original cause/reason no longer even exists. 15 years is enough - ask again who is making the best offering locally?

attributes.action: Centrally Fund a Tram or Underground for the Leeds-Bradford City Region
attributes.background: The West Yorkshire Urban Area is home to a population of approximately 2.3million people. If less wealthy countries are able to ensure their sizeable cities have mass transit systems, it should be of national concern that the UK, as the 9th wealthiest country in the world, is unwilling to do so.
attributes.additional_details: Any urban area within Europe of a similar size has either a tram, light rail, or underground network – some have two of the three. Examples include Turin, Prague, Vienna, Stockholm, Lyon, and our neighbours Manchester. HM Treasury figures show that London receives nearly £2600 per person in transport spending whereas Yorkshire and Humber receives £160. Transport for the North estimates the North is owed a £59 billion catch-up spend to bring our level of investment up to London spending.

attributes.action: A minimum prison sentence of 10 years for attempting to meet after grooming.
attributes.background: Too many crimes are being committed against children on a daily basis, these are wrecking their childhoods and are given poor sentences. I want to see a minimum of 10 yrs for attempting to meet a child after grooming. Not suspended and only rehabiltate inside away from our children. Give us justice.

attributes.action: Make prescriptions free for people living with heart conditions
attributes.background: Coronary heart disease remains the number 1 killer in the UK. Every 7 minutes someone in the UK will have a heart attack and 800,000 people are living with heart failure every year. Despite this heart patients still have to pay for medication which is not affordable for everyone.

attributes.action: Offer African languages from across the continent as formally recognised GCSEs
attributes.background: There are over 15 modern languages offered as a GCSE, however none of the languages offered cover countries across the African continent.
attributes.additional_details:
According the the 2011 census 1.8% of the UK population are Black African and that is set to grow, therefore children of Black African descent should be given the opportunity to achieve a modern language GCSE in their mother tongue.

http://www.voice-online.co.uk/article/2011-census-british-africans-now-dominant-black-group

https://www.mirror.co.uk/news/uk-news/up-a-third-uk-population-3500561

attributes.action: Increase funding to police forces
attributes.background: As aired on ‘crimewave 2018: a lawless Britain’ 9 out of 10 crimes go unsolved and police lack resources.
attributes.additional_details: The UK has suffered from the increase of crime especially knife crime as well as an increase of burglaries over the past year, this is the result of decreased funding the government has given the police. We now need the government to give police forces in England and Wales enough funds to be able to put more police officers on our streets to keep the public safe and to increase funding. They should also increase funding to Scotland and Northern Ireland so that they can do the same.

attributes.action: All consumer goods should carry a "vegan" or "non-vegan" label.
attributes.background: Most shop bought items, for example cosmetics and toilet roll are not marked as containing animal products or being tested on animals. This makes them inappropriate for Vegans. In many cases, large stores such as Asda carry so many products that they themselves are not aware which ones can be used.
attributes.additional_details:
When enquiring of Asda whether their own brand of toilet roll "Shades" contain animal gelatin or fatty acids, the response was:

"Due to the ever increasing ranges of vegan products we don't have a list of all the many vegan products that we have available"

This could have been for any product and as such makes it difficult to tell if a product is cruelty free. All UK manufacturers (including food) should clearly mark all products at source, stating whether or not they are suitable for vegans.

attributes.action: Lower the cervical smearing age to 16 years old.
attributes.background: I feel that the cervical smearing age should be lowered. If the legal age for having sex is 16 years old in the UK then why is cervical smearing age 25? The HPV virus is transmitted via sexual intercourse, virtually all cases of cervical cancer recorded in the UK were caused by the HPV virus.
attributes.additional_details: People who have been experiencing five years of pain, discomfort and bleeding can go in and out of hospital, not find the problem and still be told that a smear cannot be offered before the age of 25. For some people this could be too late.

attributes.action: Remove 'Mrs' and 'Miss' on all government docs & forms and use only 'Ms' instead
attributes.background: Why is it that women designate their marital status when men don't? It's 2018, this indirect sexism shouldn't be supported by the UK government. 'Miss' and 'Mrs' have no place in this era of equality, let's have them replaced by one single designation 'Ms'; just like 'Mr' and the now disused 'Mstr'.

attributes.action: Review personal independence payment screening for Chronic “invisible” illness
attributes.background: Chronic illness such as Crohn’s disease is on a rapid incline and many people are suffering and left unable to work and support themselves and are living on the edge of homelessness day in day out and It would appear that the DWP wish to completely overlook or dismiss such illnesses as we can walk.
attributes.additional_details:
The questions involved are completely irrelevant to illnesses where you can be seen to be able bodied. but illnesses such as Crohn’s disease and ulcerative colitis as well as many others are being completely overlooked due to reasons such as “you can prepare a meal”, “You can shower and clean yourself.” “You can walk 100 meters” but these factors don’t mean that we can hold down a full time job and in some cases even part time. But more often than not we need support and assistance.

The Government should review whether the PIP process is treating people with invisible illnesses fairly and ensure assessors and questions are suitable.

attributes.action:
SIGN THE UN TREATY ON THE PROHIBITION
OF NUCLEAR WEAPONS.
attributes.background: In 2017 The UN has approved a Treaty which prohibits nations from developing, testing, manufacturing, transferring, possessing, using or threatening to use nuclear weapons, or allowing these to be stationed on their territory. 122 countries were in favour; 69 did not vote, including the UK.
attributes.additional_details: The Doomsday Clock, published by the distinguished Bulletin of the Atomic Scientists, now stands at 2 minutes to midnight; the closest to total catastrophe since the Cold War. Nuclear weapons are the most destructive, inhumane and indiscriminate weapopns ever created. A single nuclear warhead, could kill millions of people. In the age of cyber warfare, the global 15,000 warheads pose a threat to human survival. The UK must lead the way to a nuclear-free and safer world by joining the UN Treaty.

attributes.action: Remove the verbal option from Food Information Regulations on Allergens.
attributes.background:
With so many people now suffering food allergies and other food related conditions, it is not acceptable for anyone to rely on word of mouth about the ingredients used.
It is not possible for staff to remember every ingredient in a dish, and there needs to be documentation to prove due diligence.
attributes.additional_details:
Currently, it is considered acceptable for food businesses to provide allergen information verbally, however, with the high staff turnover for which the hospitality industry is renowned, this is not adequate, safe, reliable, or practical. 
It is much more practical to provide written documents with full ingredients lists, to use standardised recipes, and have staff trained on accredited courses. In a court of law, a business must 'prove due diligence', this, surely, cannot be achieved verbally.

attributes.action: Create an NHS service equipped to help people with autism & mental health issues
attributes.background:
Many people with Autism struggle to get mental health support despite being 80% more likely to suffer from it!
66% of newly diagnosed individuals have contemplated suicide... this is a ridiculous statistic. 
Change needs to happen!!
attributes.additional_details: I lost my best friend to suicide back in 2015, he had autism and suffered from depression and was on a waiting list for mental health services, however a lot of these services are unequipped and shy away from supporting individuals with autism, because of our communication difficulties. We are often labelled as not engaging due to not being able to verbalise what’s happening as easy as other service users and often get discharged or misunderstood, there needs to be a service that helps us!

attributes.action: Don't ban pet shops from being able to sell puppies and kittens.
attributes.background: The wrong people will be punished along with the innocent. Pet shops have licenses to sell them. Also what will happen to these poor animals now pet shops will not be able to take them in.

attributes.action: Make it a criminal offence to humanely kill and eat dogs in the UK.
attributes.background: The killing and eating of a dog is only illegal if the method of slaughter is deemed to have caused unnecessary suffering - otherwise eating the meat is still allowed in the UK. The government must make this a criminal offence.

attributes.action: Make medication prescribed for Parkinson’s Disease free to all sufferers
attributes.background: PD requires daily medication, with it many can still contribute, without it none will. Just because science has not discovered a test for diagnosis does not make the Disease any less debilitating. Make treatment free as for diabetes.

attributes.action: Abolish the statutory fee that is charged when you collect your stolen vehicle.
attributes.background: Whenever a stolen vehicle is recovered by the police, you must pay a statutory fee to get your vehicle back.  If you refuse to pay, your vehicle will after 14 days be confiscated permanently and either sold or scrapped i.e. stolen from you again.  The fee increases daily.  It is unjust and unfair.

attributes.action: Automatic imprisonment for assaulting member of emergency services.
attributes.background: Members of the NHS and other emergency service members are being subjected to an increase in physical assaults and threats whilst attempting to carry out their lawful duty.
attributes.additional_details: Members of the Fire and Rescue Services are the latest in a long list of public services who are suffering physical threat and injury at the hands of criminal elements within our society.

attributes.action: Stop the bedroom tax and stop homelessness increasing.
attributes.background:
The government should stop the bedroom tax and help the vulnerable on
limited budgets. Homelessness is on the increase and this tax is helping
towards those figures due to people not been able to pay for the rent shortfall out of their limited benefits.
attributes.additional_details: With the universal credits system taking 6 weeks before getting paid, the bedroom tax is another expense that people are struggling with and making people homeless.

attributes.action: A minimum 6 month driving ban for mobile phone use whilst driving.
attributes.background: I am a Class 1 HGV driver and I am sick to death of people texting and phoning whilst driving. I see dozens of people doing this from my high vantage point in a truck everyday. The current punishment is deterring no one. A ban will make the majority change their habits when livelihoods are at stake.
attributes.additional_details: There are many well documented cases of the death and destruction caused by these selfish drivers.

attributes.action: Stop the Exportation of Plastic Waste abroad
attributes.background:
The UK uses 3.3 million tonnes of plastic each year & around two-thirds of that is sent abroad to countries such as Malaysia, & Indonesia with no guarantee that it will be recycled.
Many of these locations do not have the infrastructure in place to deal with plastic & so it ends up in our oceans.
attributes.additional_details:
The government currently have not done enough to proactively investigate the risks to the environment associated with this practice.

According to the Ocean Conservancy, plastic has been found in more than 60% of all seabirds and 100% of sea turtle species.
Ingesting plastic has life-threatening effects on wildlife & this plastic eventually ends up being digested by humans.

The scale of this issue is huge & the UK are contributing to it. Please support the ban on exporting our plastic waste.

attributes.action: Make food bill right to protect the most vulnerable people
attributes.background: Protecting & giving people the most basic need that is a food bill right & to making sure everyone had a right to eat & no one go without.  People go to work but no choice to choose between paying bills or put food on the table driving them into debts or those are without benefits/homeless
attributes.additional_details: You only have to look at media and how wrong it is that people are so poor & destitute that are force to live on the street without the mean to getting food.  Also people benefits had been stopped through no fault of their own. So providing foods voucher that cover all types of diets. Those that eat animal products those that are vegetarian & vegans. They can all meet the criteria of eating healthy. This is to protecting the most vulnerable in needs

attributes.action: Ban Wild Animal Trophy’s entry into the UK
attributes.background: Ban Trophy Hunters bringing their murdered animals heads and skins into the UK. These creatures are being ‘hunted’ in ‘the wild’ for pleasure with considerable cruelty. The animals have no chance as the ‘hunts’ are set up by the land owners pruely for profit and the satisfaction of the most cruel.
attributes.additional_details:
A lion suffered incredible cruelty for at least 10 hours, severely wounded and slowly dying.
Clearly, although the wound was severe, the arrow had missed the vital organs or arteries that would have caused rapid blood loss and a relatively quick death.
Certainly, the lion was so incapacitated that in all those hours he'd been able to move only 350 meters from the place where he was shot.
Judging from the events described the injured lion most likely was killed 10/12 hours after being wounded.

attributes.action: Reintroduce the Eurasian lynx as soon as possible.
attributes.background: There are 1.5 million deer in the UK, which is a massive overpopulation. They are overgrazing our woodlands causing a significant loss in biodiversity. Reintroducing the lynx would be a long-term solution to this issue and would restore balance to the UK's ecosystems.
attributes.additional_details: The Lynx UK Trust published research documents about a lynx reintroduction in 2015. It is now 2018 and no action has been taken by the government. Our country is one of the most nature-depleted countries in the world, with 53% of our species in decline. I would suggest that the lynx be reintroduced within 1 year of this petition receiving 10,000 signatures, as we need to act fast. If you want to read more go to The Lynx UK Trust's website. The Government should approve the reintroduction licence as soon as possible.

attributes.action: Insist the UK Government reject advice of the Senior Salaries Review for Judges
attributes.background: The Senior Salaries Review Body has recommended a pay rise of 32% for Judges. The reason given is low moral and changes to their pensions. With many Civil Servants receiving 1% for 10 years in a row, this is totally unacceptable. The Government cannot accept this whilst we are still in austerity
attributes.additional_details: As reported in many newspapers and the BBC on 12 October 2018.

attributes.action: Ensure that there is a Mental Health nurse or doctor in every GP practice
attributes.background:
I feel as if the current system in place in GP surgeries is inadequate for the amount of people that are facing mental health issues in this country.

'At any time, one in six adults has a mental health condition and one in 100 has a severe mental illness.' (Nuffield Trust, 2015)
attributes.additional_details: From personal experience, I feel that you do not get the same level of care with a normal GP, as they are not necessarily trained across the mental health spectrum. They rush the 10 minute appointment because they have 100s of patients to see per day. This needs to change. There needs to be a dedicated member of staff for times of crisis, and for people that maybe need longer appointments to explain their issues.

attributes.action: Make assured tenancies equal as secured tenancies in regards to domestic abuse
attributes.background: Victims of domestic abuse can get secured tenancies transferred to them in their sole if they wish to remain in the property yet they cannot do this with assured tenancies with housing associations. This needs to change to make things fair.
attributes.additional_details: Even when people have been the victims of emotional, mental and financial abuse, housing associations are not prepared to transfer their tenancy without consent from the other joint tenant. This is unfair.

attributes.action: Support the Prime Minister's Brexit Deal
attributes.background: I run a small business and the uncertainty around Brexit is completely unacceptable. There is no deal available that will satisfy everyone and what the PM has negotiated gives a degree of certainty the business community needs. No Deal or leaving on WTO Terms is not an option.

attributes.action: Right to buy for ALL social housing tenants, a fair chance at security for all!
attributes.background: Myself (tenant for 17 years) and my mother (tenant for 25 years) would like to buy our homes but neither of us qualify despite all our neighbours qualifying because they were tenants before the properties transferred to Housing association and our properties miss right to acquire rules by 1 year
attributes.additional_details:
It’s discrimination to say 1 has a right and 1 doesn’t. 
We are in the same properties on the same street owned by the same Housing association but those that want to buy can’t and those that can don’t want to! 
Give us a right to buy the homes we have lived in, raised our children in and made our own. Give our children security for their futures.
When we applied for social housing it’s because we had no alternative, now let us buy our HOMES and use the money for much needed additional housing!

attributes.action: Doctors should have priority access to NHS treatment to enable fast returntowork
attributes.background: NHS demand is increasing  with UK increasing and ageing population. Number of doctors is in decline worse affected is General Practice For improving recruitment, retention and workforce capacity allowing Doctors to have fast track access to NHS treatments will help their return back to work quickly.
attributes.additional_details:
The supply of GPs is under growing strain as the workforce ages.
In 2010, more than a fifth of GPs were aged 55 and over; those leaving the profession rose by 7.8 per cent and surveys indicate a further 10,000 GPs plan to retire in the next five years. 
At the same time, the proportion of medical trainees choosing to enter GP specialty training has fallen. AE, mental health, secondary care cant keep the services with no Doctors.

attributes.action: Enhanced Maternity / Paternity Benefits for Employees of Large Corporations
attributes.background: I wish for it to be made a legal requirement for large corporate companies who employee over 50,000 employees to pay enhanced Maternity / Paternity benefits as some industry leaders already do. The gap between the government minimum&some industry leaders is outstanding eg. Ford pay 52 weeks full pay
attributes.additional_details: Recently I was lucky enough to fall pregnant&welcome my first child in to the world. Before I did so, I was completely unaware of the difference between the maternity / paternity packages that different large organisations had in place. The difference between you and another Mum / Dad might be in excess of thousands of pounds which makes a huge different to any working family. I propose for all large organisations to pay the same, enhanced package rather than the government minimum guideline.

attributes.action: Make political education compulsory in secondary schools.
attributes.background: In our politics class we have been debating the crisis of participation and the democratic deficit. We feel that a lack of political participation is caused partly by a lack of political education - so people don't understand how important it is to make their voice heard through voting.

attributes.action: Make bullying awareness part of the national curriculum in all schools.
attributes.background: I feel too many children are suffering from bullying on a daily basis, and not enough action is being done. Yes schools have posters about zero tolerance on bullying, but how many kids actually pay attention. I feel a minimum of 30 minutes a week classroom time will make children more aware.
attributes.additional_details: I have never struggled with bullying personally, but after reading a heart breaking story of a young boy, who sadly took his own life due to bullying, I feel it is time to integrate bullying awareness into children's lives, and the ideal place for this to take place is in the classroom, across all ages and all schools. I strongly believe a bullying awareness curriculum in schools could lower this stigma and ideally save lives.

attributes.action: Get the Government to fund the completion of the new Royal Liverpool Hospital.
attributes.background: The new Royal Liverpool University Hospital stands incomplete because of the collapse of Carillion. Government intervention and the allocation of public funds would enable the swift completion of the new hospital so that patients and NHS staff get the hospital the people of Merseyside deserve.
attributes.additional_details: Our new hospital stands idle and incomplete thanks to the collapse of Carillion. The Government should intervene as a matter of urgency and take direct action, including the allocation of public funds, to ensure the hospital’s completion. It is grossly wrong that patients and NHS staff should have to put up with the old hospital, which is falling into disrepair and demonstrably impacting on patient care.

attributes.action: Strip Southeastern Railway of its ill managed franchise.
attributes.background: Southeastern Railway is making the lives of commuters miserable. Those in SE London and Kent are getting to work late, getting home late and packed into cattle like carriages on a daily basis, whilst paying thousands a year for the privilege .They do not deserve the benefit of this franchise.

attributes.action: Make it Law for all Nursing / Care Homes to store a Defribrillator (AED)
attributes.background: Elderly parients are at higher risk of life threatening cardiac arrest and very few Nursing / Care homes have static AED (Automated External Defibrillator) units in place which delays life saving treatment to the parient. without immediate treatment 90-95% of sudden cardiac arrest victims will die.
attributes.additional_details: If AED is used and effective CPR is performed within 3-5minutes of cardiac arrest, the patients chance of survival increases from 6% to 74%. The Emergency services average response time to a cardiac event related incident in an urban area is 11 minutes. For every minute that goes by a victim of a sudden cardiac arrest does not receive treatment, their chance of survival decreases by 10%. If defibrillation occurs within 1 minute of the victim collapsing the patient survival rate increases to 90%.

attributes.action: Force NHS Trusts and their clients to pay their employees "AFC for Contractors"
attributes.background:
The NHS is outsourcing hospital services to clients who employ long term contractors to carry out services such as Catering, Cleaning and domestic services, Porters, Security, Linen and laundry services, Switchboard and reception services

The pay rates are usually poor with no ehancements
attributes.additional_details:
Contractors who are working in the NHS on a long term basis should receive the agenda for change pay in line with other NHS workers. 
These jobs were originally available directly working for the NHS. The pay rate for the demanding job role is low and has become very uncompetitve which results in poor staff retention and also poor service provided which effects the patient care. 

Savings made should not come from the workforce.

attributes.action: Require companies with 100+ employees to offer a bike2work scheme to all staff
attributes.background:
Many large companies do not offer a bike2work scheme for no reason other than lazyness. 

Lots more people would cycle given the opportunity to do so and as the government is aware cycles are a massive aid in reducing both emissions and congestion it'll benefit everyone in various ways
attributes.additional_details:
It's proven cycling is good for health, less strain on NHS

Cycling instead of driving reduces emissions - less strain on NHS, better for planet, and helps meet city air pollution requirements

Less congestion meaning more profitable businesses, more interest in business, easier access to emergency services

Healthier work forces - less early retirments on medical.grounds, less sick pay etc

attributes.action: Zero Hour contracts should be abolished.
attributes.background:
Zero hours contracts should be abolished to stop exploitation of the work force. They do not offer regular working hours and lead to poor working practices. 
It is time Government legislated to outlaw them.

attributes.action: Require all supermarkets to have an Eco packaging/Local produce/Vegan section
attributes.background: People know of the harm that use of plastic/meat and dairy industry/food flown thousands of miles is having on the planet and are doing all they can, but options are limited and that makes people feel there's not much they can help with. So with this petition we require ALL supermarkets to have:
attributes.additional_details:
1.ECO Section: include zero- plastic products - 'naked' veg and fruit; grains, bread, pasta, spices packaged in paper; milk, oils, juices in glass bottles; toiletries - solid shampoos, conditioners, toothpaste, deodorants
 
2.Local Produce Section: to reduce carbon footprint of our shopping, consumers should be able to easily find products grown locally.
 
3.Increase vegan produce at least two-fold, stocking a reasonable selection in local stores as well, giving eco friendly options to everyone

attributes.action: Ban organised pre-election TV debates between Party Leaders
attributes.background: Pre election TV Debates between political party leaders are a distraction; they rely too heavily on personalities, not the relevant issues. ‘Accidents on the night’ can have too big an impact on election outcomes!

attributes.action: Allow vehicle tax to remain with the vehicle upon transfer of ownership.
attributes.background:
When the DVLA stopped issuing paper tax disc the ability to transfer vehicle tax to a new owner was also removed. 
This means that in many cases the tax is paid by both the seller and buyer for the month the car changes hands.

attributes.action: Provide loans to help citizens who become seriously ill abroad return home
attributes.background: My uncle, Charlie, had a stroke in Cambodia and was on life support. Repatriation to the UK was £105,000. There must be a contingency plan for sick British nationals with no insurance who need to be repatriated. No British citizen should die because they can't afford medical care.
attributes.additional_details: The Government should provide a reasonable loan scheme that families can use to get their loved ones home. These loans should be paid back as and when it is realistically possible for the family to do so.
